text: ah hi everyone Bethany breath Tiano here
the internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review of this new Gene
Dawson record chaos now this is a brand
new LP from singer songwriter
multi-instrumentalist multimedia artist
Mr Gene Dawson following up his
breakthrough 2020 album pixel bath which
was far from perfect but still showed a
lot of volatile creativity on Gene's
part mashing together elements of punk
rock and bedroom pop and Hip-Hop and R B
and Lo-Fi Emo music as well and he mixed
all these Styles together into a series
of very raw and catchy Raiders maybe a
little too small scale in terms of their
sound and presentation but still the
ideas and energy going into these tracks
were very big and now with chaos now I
feel like Gene's Ambitions are grander
the base is covered on this thing are
wider somehow stylistically Gene becomes
even more difficult to pin down while
also sinking a lot of his efforts into
these tracks that have almost a big alt
rock radio single type sound which is
something he couldn't sound more
glorious pursuing now I was a little
skeptical going into this LP because I
wasn't super crazy about some of the
singles there's three heads whose unique
rap and rock Fusion feels a bit off
thanks to these random mellow detours
and the Very staccato riffs on the
chorus that come off a bit too stiff
there's a lot of intriguing ideas going
into this track I just don't think
there's a very coherent flow to them
then Pirate Radio I found to at first be
a pretty interesting change of pace for
Gene more of an acoustic Vibe and I
think tonally it does fit as a closer
for this record but stylistically I just
kind of saw this thing as just very
plain as day indie folk no more no less
a very derivative of bony bear and for
sure it's cool to hear that Gene has the
refinement to be able to pull something
like this off but did he put his own
spin on it in the same way that he has
many other genres thus far not really in
my opinion but with that being said
there were a few other teasers on this
day thing I did enjoy quite a bit
they're sick of it which is handily one
of the best Reverb soaked punk rock
bangers that you're going to hear this
year it sounds like watching a neon lit
mosh pit at night in slow motion it's
aggressive righteous and rocketing off
into space and two minutes flat there's
bad fruit which is not just a very good
ballad but also more insight into jeans
talents for genre mashing with more
gentle indie folk guitars elegant
strings which gradually Ascend into this
gorgeous display of instrumentation fit
for a movie soundtrack and then to top
it all off on the back end of the track
we have a really cool wrap tie-in
featuring Earl's sweatshirt Earl comes
through with some really dejected and
personal lyrics and a melodic flow that
really fits with the full backdrop of
the track I'll also add I think Gene has
gotten more compelling as a Lyricist too
as he laces the song with all these cute
contrasting and some of cryptic bits of
imagery I'm a tornado in the sunshine uh
the moon running from the sunrise so
yeah there were singles on this thing
that I liked and I was even happier to
here that a majority of the deep cuts on
here were pretty good too there's the
incredibly blunt Glory which I found to
be a totally Kick-Ass dejected alt Rock
Anthem with an acoustic intro lots of
lyrics where Gene is kind of embracing
his own dysfunction and other people's
uh perception of it there's a crushing
hook on the track as well and Gene
effectively does a great job of tapping
into the really angsty and in your face
Simplicity of a lot of great 90s rock
singles which is also the case for the
song porn acting too but don't mistake
these tracks is like simply an exercise
in Nostalgia because there's enough
digital effects and cool little weird
modern details in there to where you
you've never mistaken for something old
there's kids eat pills where Gene
further Embraces his weirdo status and
sings about dreaming in dreams and
escaping from a dream total dreamception
over some heavy rock guitars and a lot
of vocal Distortion plus a really cool
uncredited feature from Isaiah Rashad
where the guy sounds like my sleep
paralysis demon spitting in my ear then
positive one negative one feels like a
funkified fever dream with some smooth
ass riff passages bookended by lyrics
from Gene where he's dreading what's
going on upstairs like three heads the
flow of this track is a bit odd and
choppy but it still conjures a really
interesting mental image and continues
to play into these ongoing themes on the
record where Gene is portrayed as kind
of being at the edge of his methyl State
there's a pretty great run of tracks in
the midsection of the record too we go
from Bad fruit to zero Heroes which
showcases these heavy grungy guitars at
the first leg leading into this really
shouty and tortured internal monologue
from Gene exploding into a harmonious
hook that shows him just kind of wanting
better and brighter days for himself
there's a super solid song structure on
this one an interesting wrap tie-in on
the bridge too and from here we have a
Flawless transition into screwface which
is another multi-faceted but somewhat
choppy cut as the chaotic and very Punky
intro eventually gives way to these uh
sort of woozy Mac to mark s guitars and
lyrically on this one gene focuses a lot
on his upbringing his background and his
ongoing mental state that sees him
weaving in and out of this spiral the
hip-hop influences on this LP come out a
little bit more in the last leg there's
black Michael Jackson featuring George
Clinton where Gene does his thing over a
pretty unique instrumental combination
there are some bent up and very
expressive Modest Mouse s guitars on
this thing some G-funk synths popping up
a little bit in the mix too but not for
too long as the radical evolution of
this track never really settles on one
idea which I think makes it hard for a
lot of what's going on to truly set in
but I can still admire the track for
being an incredibly unique series of
sounds then there's huh which to me came
off kind of like a young jpeg Mafia or
even Donald Glover going wild over a
lumbering heavy beat that's uh
underscored by some Mike Dean S guitar
harmonies which yeah sounds weird but
actually really comes off as being more
epic than you might think though I think
the outro passage is one of a handful of
moments on this LP that proved to be a
little awkward transition wise and I
suppose that's my thing with the record
the execution moving from section to
section in a song the combination of
influences it doesn't always come across
as clean but still a lot of what's going
on here is a bold and unbridled show of
creativity from a guy who clearly sees
way fewer boundaries in the world of
music than most do which during some
moments of this LP has its downsides in
terms of focus and control but
simultaneously it also pays dividends in
very bold and refreshing ideas across
this thing with this record while I'm
not in love with it I think Gene Dawson
continues to be one of the most
interesting Minds to peer into
artistically in the underground and if
you're into any of the variety of genres
that are going into this record I highly
recommend that you give it a try I'm
